author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: No. 5 Bloomsburg Falls 2-0 to No. 6 West Chester in PSAC Clash
text:
No. 5 Bloomsburg Falls 2-0 to No. 6 West Chester in PSAC Clash
The No. 5-ranked Bloomsburg field hockey team suffered a 2-0 defeat against No. 6 West Chester in a PSAC matchup. Despite outshooting West Chester in the final quarter, Bloomsburg (12-3, 4-3 PSAC) was unable to capitalize on opportunities while West Chester (10-4, 5-2) managed to find the net twice. The game's only goals were scored during penalty corners, with Veerle Hersman contributing both for West Chester. Bloomsburg had several chances but couldn't break through West Chester's defense and goalkeeper, Audra Szymborski, making critical saves. The Huskies will attempt to bounce back in their next game against IUP on October 25th.
- Shots: Bloomsburg 11, West Chester 17
- Shots on Goal: Bloomsburg 5, West Chester 8
- Bloomsburg lost its second PSAC game of the season.
- West Chester's defense has been effective, limiting Bulldogs' scoring chances.
Bloomsburg is set to face IUP on October 25, aiming to secure a win in the final regular season road game.
Bottom LineThe Huskies must refocus and capitalize on scoring opportunities to stay competitive in the PSAC as they head into the last stretch of the season.
Read more at Bloomsburg Athletics
